Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. No. 1 Prop No. 1 -- 7.75 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 1 Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 1, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of seven and seventy-five hundredths (7.75) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $77,500 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. No. 1 Prop No. 2 -- 4.58 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 1 Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 1, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of four and fifty-eight hundredths (4.58) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $45,800 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. Number 2 -- $400K Bond - BOC - 15 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall Washington Parish Fire Protection District Number 2, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Four Hundred Thousand Dollars ($400,000), to run not exceeding fifteen (15) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding six per centum (6%) per annum, to be sold at par, premium or discount, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing and improving buildings, machinery and equipment, including fire stations, to be used in giving fire protection to the property in the District, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated 2.70 mills to be levied in the first year of issue to pay said Bonds?
